original_solution_mapping.L1: There were 12.6 - 4.6 = <<12.6-4.6=8>>8 gigabytes used after deleting some files.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then, the used space went up to 8 + 2 = <<8+2=10>>10 gigabytes after storing other files.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, the new 20 gigabytes external drive will have 20 - 10 = <<20-10=10>>10 gigabytes free.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4179.
    Returns: the number of free gigabytes the new external drive will have.
    """
    # L1
    initial_used_gb = 12.6 # 12.6 gigabytes used
    deleted_folder_gb = 4.6 # delete a folder of size 4.6 gigabytes
    used_after_delete_gb = initial_used_gb - deleted_folder_gb

    # L2
    new_files_gb = 2 # new files of 2 gigabytes
    final_used_gb = used_after_delete_gb + new_files_gb

    # L3
    new_drive_capacity_gb = 20 # new external drive of size 20 gigabytes
    free_space_new_drive_gb = new_drive_capacity_gb - final_used_gb

    # FA
    answer = free_space_new_drive_gb
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There were {initial_used_gb} - {deleted_folder_gb} = <<{initial_used_gb}-{deleted_folder_gb}={used_after_delete_gb}>>{used_after_delete_gb} gigabytes used after deleting some files.
Then, the used space went up to {used_after_delete_gb} + {new_files_gb} = <<{used_after_delete_gb}+{new_files_gb}={final_used_gb}>>{final_used_gb} gigabytes after storing other files.

Thus, the new {new_drive_capacity_gb} gigabytes external drive will have {new_drive_capacity_gb} - {final_used_gb} = <<{new_drive_capacity_gb}-{final_used_gb}={free_space_new_drive_gb}>>{free_space_new_drive_gb} gigabytes free.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: There were 12.6 - 4.6 = <<12.6-4.6=8>>8 gigabytes used after deleting some files.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'used_after_delete_gb' (value: 8.0) was reported instead of 'free_space_new_drive_gb' (value: 10.0).
